result.execSummary:
The defendant Malynda Sue Andrews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with:  CONCURRENT, with credit for 114 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.

Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
Use a physician disclosure form.
Cognitive intervention programming.
Trauma or grief counseling.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malynda Sue Andrews

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (20 pages) commencing June 17, 2015 received and filed.
Associated with Charge #1
from the Defendant, received and filed. lms

Defendant Malynda Sue Andrews in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Malynda Sue Andrews in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 33 MONTHS, CONCURRENT, with credit for 114 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Use a physician disclosure form.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Truama or grief counseling.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court denies defense request for expungment.

*Court orders suspension of driving privileges for 12 months.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 6.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Court vacates the warrant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Malynda Sue Andrews in court with attorney David J Lang.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 6/4/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms
Attorney David J Lang in court, defendant Malynda Sue Andrews not in court, in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malynda Sue Andrews in court with attorney David J. Lang.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malynda Sue Andrews in court with attorney David J Lang.  William Levins for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Malynda Sue Andrews in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
